Nicole Walters: Automate Systems, Not Relationships
Nicole Walters: Automate Systems, Not Relationships
Nicole Walters: The Importance of Styling the Workplace to Fit Your Needs
Nicole Walters Wants You to Know It's Okay if You Can't Handle Everything All At Once

speakerTopic.text:
This is not your normal keynote; it is not your normal motivational hour. When Nicole dedicates time to speak with an audience, she makes sure every single person walks away served with a purposeful message. Her focus is on evidence-based insights that produce brilliance in professionals, business owners, entrepreneurs, students, and leaders.

In a way you have never heard before, Nicole discusses why people stop before they even start, what keeps them stuck and what they need to save themselves from sitting in their “one day” mentality for one more day. Nicole speaks from a strategic perspective but also from the heart as she shares her stories of true endurance and growth. She reveals what led to her success as she grew her side hustle from recording at her bathroom basin into multiple seven-figure businesses and also what obstacles attempted to get in her way.

Nicole’s keynote will arouse tears of joy, heartache, and inspiration; however, it is also practical and actionable. Rather than just planning for where you are today, Nicole leaves audiences motivated to start building to where they want to be.
speakerTopic.title: No One Is Coming To Save You

speakerTopic.text:
Whether you are an emerging entrepreneur, run an established company, or are trying to climb the corporate ladder, Nicole will equip you with the necessary tools and strategies to take your business and mindset to the next level. Leveraging her years of corporate experience as a Fortune 500 executive, Nicole breaks down complex business concepts into step-by-step tasks to help you build income streams based on what you know and do best.

As CEO and Founder of Inherit Learning Company, she has developed signature training programs and consulting services that incorporate proven business principles that help you make sound decisions that ensure lasting success.

Nicole identifies unique ways to gain the confidence and clarity to pursue purpose and build profitable ventures doing what you love.

A relatable and genuine leader, top business conferences have tapped Nicole Walters to serve as a keynote speaker. Audiences often remark on her transparent, practical, and motivating approach to both business and life.
speakerTopic.title: Fierce Clarity: How to Zero-In on Your Purpose and Profitability

speakerBioSummary.text:
• Nicole Walters specializes in business development training for anyone from students to emerging entrepreneurs to established business owners.
  • Her unique and immersive programs help audiences gain the confidence and clarity to chase their goals and build profitable ventures doing what they love.
  • Nicole is adept at identifying ways to turn influence into income and popularity into profits. Whether on her top-rated business podcast or when she’s dropping gems from the event stage, Walters champions the long-term payoff of intentionally pursuing purpose.
  • Viral videos of her juggling family and fortune have racked up over 30 million views and generated coverage on The Today Show, Good Morning America, Woman’s Day, and Babble. Additionally, Walters has shared her business expertise with publications including Entrepreneur, Essence and Forbes.
  • Most recently, Nicole was named one of Forbes' Next 1,000 Top Entrepreneurs.
  • She is set to release a yet-to-be-titled memoir in 2023.

speakerBiography.text:
Nicole Walters is on a mission to inspire people to not only live better lives, but also leave a legacy. She is adept at identifying ways to turn influence into income and popularity into profits. Whether on her top-rated business podcast or when she’s dropping gems from the event stage, Walters champions the long-term payoff of intentionally pursuing purpose.

After spending more than a decade working as a sales executive at Fortune 500 companies, Walters found herself at a crossroads. While her bank account boomed, she felt unfulfilled and bankrupt of the joy and economic freedom she desired. With a plan, a strong belief in her God-given talents and a deep desire to be her own boss, Walters left her six-figure job. She sought expert help and support. Within six months of taking the leap of faith, she successfully converted her part-time side hustle into a full-time business. Since then, she has built a multi-million-dollar personal development and business education empire.

As the CEO and Founder of NapNic, LLC, Walters specializes in business development training for emerging entrepreneurs and established business owners. From stay at home parents to small business owners, her transformative resources help everyday entrepreneurs get richer – in finances, relationships and health. NapNic, LLC offers insight into proven corporate strategies and business principles that can catapult barely-surviving companies into thriving enterprises. Her firm’s unique and immersive programs help business owners gain the confidence and clarity to build profitable ventures doing what they love.

Viral videos of her juggling family and fortune have racked up over 30 million views and generated coverage on The Today Show, Good Morning America, Woman’s Day and Babble. Additionally, Walters has shared her business expertise with publications including Entrepreneur, Essence and Forbes.

A relatable and authentic leader, top business conferences such as the Marketing Impact Academy, Business Boutique, ConvertKit, FinCon and more have tapped Walters to serve as a keynote speaker. Members of her audience often remark on her transparent, practical and motivating approach to both business and life.

Walters is also the host of the popular and highly-rated Nicole Walters podcast, where she doles out entrepreneurship and lifestyle tips. Each week, thousands of listeners tune in to get nuggets of wisdom. When she’s not helping entrepreneurs optimize their businesses, Walters enjoys spending time with her husband and three children.
